output.concept: A solar-powered, remotely managed traffic signal with energy harvesting, edge computing for local decision making, and wireless communication to a central traffic management system.
research: PV sizing and seasonal energy balance
traffic signal timing standards and centralized control (NTCIP, NEMA TS 2, MUTCD)
low-power microcontroller vs single-board computer tradeoffs
communication options (LoRaWAN, NB-IoT, LTE-M, Wi-Fi) and coverage
LED driver reliability and fault-tolerant operation

problems_overall.problem: Intermittent solar energy causing power shortages during low sun days
problems_overall.suggested_solution: Adequate energy storage sizing with MPPT charge controller; duty-cycle based load shedding; optional hybrid backup (supercapacitor buffer) to cover peak demands.

problems_overall.problem: Sensing reliability under adverse weather or occlusion
problems_overall.suggested_solution: Multi-sensor fusion (camera + IR/Radar) with fault detection and self-test; redundant sensing paths where feasible.

problems_overall.problem: Time synchronization and network dependency for coordinated cycles
problems_overall.suggested_solution: GPS-based time sync or local RTC with periodic calibration; robust fallback timing logic at the controller.

problems_overall.problem: Outdoor hardware reliability and environmental stress
problems_overall.suggested_solution: Industrial-grade enclosures (IP66), weather sealing, conformal coating, and surge/transient protection; routine maintenance alerts.

options.name: Inductive loop detectors
options.why_it_works: Proven vehicle presence detection with low power and mature infrastructure.

options.name: Camera-based vision with edge AI
options.why_it_works: Flexible sensing capable of vehicle and pedestrian detection with software upgrades.

options.name: Radar-based short-range presence detector
options.why_it_works: Reliable in rain, fog, and night; non-contact sensing.
pros: Low false positives with proper integration

options.name: Solar panel array + LiFePO4 battery + MPPT controller
options.why_it_works: Reliable, long cycle life with moderate cost; robust in hot climates.

options.name: Flexible solar panels + Li-ion pouch battery + PWM controller
options.why_it_works: Lower weight and cost; compact packaging.
cons: PWM less efficient at partial loads

options.name: Hybrid energy storage with supercapacitors + lead-acid battery
options.why_it_works: Handles peak loads and provides rapid discharge/charge.

options.name: Low-power MCU with RTOS (e.g., STM32 + FreeRTOS)
options.why_it_works: Deterministic timing with minimal power; easy real-time sequencing.

options.name: Single-board computer (e.g., Raspberry Pi Zero W) with Linux
options.why_it_works: Faster development and flexible software stack.
pros: Good support for networking and vision

options.name: FPGA-based timing engine with MCU control
options.why_it_works: Deterministic, high-precision timing for signaling sequences.

options.name: LED modules with constant-current drivers
options.why_it_works: Standard, energy-efficient signal actuation with long life.
cons: Driver failures can affect multiple LEDs

options.name: LED modules with PWM-controlled drivers
options.why_it_works: Fine-grained sequencing and potential brightness control for energy savings.

options.name: LED modules with solid-state relays for channel isolation
options.why_it_works: Isolated switching improves fault containment and safety.

options.name: NB-IoT / LTE-M cellular module
options.why_it_works: Widely available network with good coverage and low power.

options.name: LoRaWAN gateway connectivity
options.why_it_works: Low-power long-range with private/public network options.

options.name: Wi-Fi at intersection with remote API
options.why_it_works: High bandwidth and simple integration in campus/urban networks.

options.name: Ethernet with centralized cloud API over VPN
options.why_it_works: Stable, secure, and predictable connectivity for fixed sites.

output.cost: Estimated capital cost range varies by scale: sensors 5–15k, power hardware 10–40k, control 5–15k, actuation 5–20k, communication 3–15k; annual maintenance and data plans add 1–5k.
output.skills: Embedded systems, power electronics, IoT networking, GIS/time-synchronization, traffic protocol standards (NTCIP), software development, fault tolerance and safety engineering
